definition: to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send

sentences.chinese: 另外我们还提供送餐服务。

sentences.english: We deliver meals to your room.
sentences.chinese: 我只负责送餐去您的房间。
餐厅提供24小时房内送餐服务。

sentences.english: In a foreign country, give the meal and semi-finished products is an important component of the fast food.
sentences.chinese: 在国外，送餐与半成品是快餐的重要组成。

sentences.english: I'm calling from room 315, and I want to order room service.
sentences.chinese: 我从315号房打来，我想要客房送餐服务。

sentences.english: On top of that, the hotel provides guests with room-service meals upon request.
sentences.chinese: 宾馆还随时提供客房送餐服务。

sentences.english: I am also happy to leisure, to the downstairs room to find a landlord asked for a menu.
sentences.chinese: 我也乐得清闲，到楼下去找房东要了一张送餐的菜单。

sentences.english: Right,we'll have your order there at 12:30.
Revenue from both the food concession and delivery service would be pumped back into the plazas.
sentences.chinese: 美食街以及送餐服务的收入都会用于步行区的建设。

sentences.english: It is stronge suggesting that no girl delivers meals upto guestrooms.
sentences.chinese: 最好不用女员工往客房送餐。

sentences.english: Room service- May I come in?
sentences.chinese: 送餐任职，我可以出去吗？

definition: to go/take out (relates to food bought at a restaurant)
(at a restaurant) to order a meal/(of a waiter) to take an order
to put together an order and deliver it (i.e. 配貨|配货[pei4 huo4] and 送貨|送货[song4 huo4])/to deliver (goods)
to take a customer's order/(of a taxi driver) to accept a booking/(of a delivery rider) to accept a delivery job
to drive a vehicle for its owner (often as a paid service for sb who has consumed alcohol) (abbr. for 代理駕駛|代理驾驶[dai4 li3 jia4 shi3])/substitute driver (abbr. for 代駕司機|代驾司机[dai4 jia4 si1 ji1])
to call a cab (by phone)/to request a ride (via an app)
